Description: Body sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black with band of single dots in added white and trace of added red; exterior mostly reserved with band fired orange-red and row of added red dots at top of sherd.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
According to Dupont and Thomas (2006, p. 79, NAU35), the geophysical characteristics of the fabric indicate that the sherd originated in Chios. The sample number 'NAU 35' is written in ink on break.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 302, pl. 152, no. 1108) (Number not precised)
Dupont & Thomas 2006 / Naukratis: Les Importations Grecques Orientales Archaïques (p. 78-79, 82-83, fig. 1) (NAU 35)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1208) (phase 2)
